basics.name: Ishwar Govind
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Computer Science graduate from IIT Palakkad working at Arista Networks, with experience in reinforcement learning, routing systems, and deep learning. Published in ACM Conference on Data Science.

work.name: Arista Networks
work.summary: Developing resilient routing features and tunneling solutions on StrataXGS-based platforms.
highlights: Reduced packet loss by 30% in ECMP scenarios with a switchover solution.
Implemented GRE Tunnel with hardware hit counters.
Worked on resilient ECMP routing and Next-Hop Groups.

work.name: Arista Networks
work.summary: Interned with StrataXGS team, worked on modular EOS and multicast routing features.
highlights: Helped program ASIC for unknown multicast packet routing.
Contributed to Linux-based EOS with multi-process architecture.

work.name: UST
work.summary: Worked on face recognition and anti-spoofing models.
highlights: Built a real-time face recognition system using MTCNN, FaceNet, and InceptionNet.
Developed an application for real-time face management.

education.summary: Achieved Honours by pursuing 12 additional elective credits. Coding Club Head. Thesis on RL-based Portfolio Optimization.

certificates.name: Building Transformer-Based Natural Language Processing Applications

publications.name: Deployability of Deep Reinforcement Learning in Portfolio Management
publications.publisher: ACM 8th International Conference on Data Science & Management of Data
publications.summary: Explores challenges in DRL for finance, including agent performance and optimal policy alignment using a synthetic market environment.

projects.name: Portfolio Optimization using Reinforcement Learning
projects.summary: Compared RAC and Transformer-based PPO agents on financial datasets, with results showing improved performance under Transformer-based agents.
highlights: Developed RL agents for optimal portfolio allocation

projects.name: Deep Weather Forecasting
projects.summary: Forecasting ISMR using spatio-temporal ConvLSTM and climate oscillation features.

projects.name: PlexShare
projects.summary: Collaborative lab monitoring app using C# and Azure Pipelines.
highlights: Integrated chat, whiteboard, and screen sharing

projects.name: Multi-Paragraph Question Answering
projects.summary: Question answering system using ELECTRA and answerability verifier.
highlights: Improved robustness via dual-layer answerability check

awards.title: 11th at ScytheCTF, Inter-IIT Tech Meet (IIT Roorkee), 2021

basics.name: Ishwar Govind
basics.label: Scientist
basics.summary: A German-born theoretical physicist, widely ranked among the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
